title: Knight's Tournament Grounds Adventure #39
goal: Solve the puzzles, achieve the main objective, and escape.

rooms.name: Knight's Pavilion
rooms.description: A grand canvas pavilion decorated with colorful banners and heraldic shields. Wooden benches line the walls, and armor stands display gleaming plate mail. The smell of leather and oil fills the air. Tournament pennants flutter from the tent poles. A heavy wooden chest sits in the corner, and various equipment is scattered about.

items.name: knight's armor stand
items.description: A wooden stand displaying a full suit of tournament armor with a blue and gold surcoat

items.name: small brass key
items.description: A brass key with a lion emblem engraved on the handle

items.name: equipment table
items.description: A sturdy table covered with tournament gear and documents

items.name: tournament proclamation
items.description: An official proclamation announcing the grand tournament
items.text: HEAR YE! The Grand Tournament of 1347 is hereby proclaimed! All knights of noble birth are invited to compete for glory and honor. The champion shall be crowned in the Champion's Hall. Lord Marshal Sir Edmund presides over all contests held upon the tournament lists.

items.name: heavy wooden chest
items.description: A reinforced chest bound with iron straps and a four-digit combination lock

items.name: iron key
items.description: A heavy iron key with intricate scrollwork

items.name: herald's scroll
items.description: A scroll containing tournament records and announcements
items.text: Tournament Records: The year 1347 marks our finest tournament yet. Sir Roland the Valiant has won every joust, proving himself the greatest champion. The armory holds the weapons and shields of all competitors. Remember: only knights of proven valor may enter the Champion's Hall.

items.name: weapon rack
items.description: A rack holding practice swords and wooden shields

items.name: squire's note
items.description: A hastily written note from a squire
items.text: Reminder: Sir Roland's shield is in the armory. The brass key opens the supply cabinet where we keep the tournament records. Don't forget - the combination to the chest is the year of this grand tournament!

items.name: locked supply cabinet
items.description: A tall cabinet with a brass lock, containing tournament supplies

items.name: tournament roster
items.description: A detailed list of all competing knights and their achievements
items.text: TOURNAMENT ROSTER: Sir Roland the Valiant - Champion of the Lists, undefeated in single combat. Sir Geoffrey of Kent - Master of the Melee. Sir William the Bold - Victor of the Archery Contest. All final jousts are held upon the tournament lists before the assembled nobility.

items.name: pavilion entrance
items.description: A canvas flap leading out to the tournament grounds and toward the armory

rooms.name: Tournament Armory
rooms.description: A stone building filled with racks of weapons, shields, and armor. Swords gleam in the torchlight, and colorful heraldic banners hang from the rafters. The air smells of metal and oil. A large table displays various shields bearing different coats of arms. The Champion's Hall lies beyond a magnificent door to the east.

items.name: heraldic shield display
items.description: A table showcasing the shields of tournament competitors
items.text: Shield Display: Sir Roland's shield - Azure, a lion rampant or. Sir Geoffrey's shield - Gules, three swords argent. Sir William's shield - Vert, a stag proper. Each knight's heraldry tells the story of their noble lineage.

items.name: weapon cabinet
items.description: A locked cabinet containing the finest tournament weapons

items.name: lance tournament record
items.description: A parchment recording jousting victories
items.text: JOUSTING RECORDS: Sir Roland the Valiant has unhorsed every opponent in the lists. His skill with the lance is unmatched. The final joust takes place on the tournament lists, where champions are made and legends are born.

items.name: armor workbench
items.description: A workbench with tools for maintaining armor and weapons

items.name: armorer's journal
items.description: A leather-bound journal kept by the master armorer
items.text: Day 47: I have repaired Sir Roland's armor after his victorious joust. He is truly the champion of this tournament. Lord Marshal Sir Edmund has declared that only knights who understand the tournament's ways may enter the Champion's Hall. Three questions guard the entrance.

items.name: champion's banner
items.description: A magnificent banner bearing Sir Roland's coat of arms
items.text: The banner displays a golden lion on a blue field - the arms of Sir Roland the Valiant, Champion of the Tournament. Beneath is inscribed: 'Victor of the Lists, Defender of Honor, Knight of the Realm.'

items.name: tournament grounds map
items.description: A detailed map showing the layout of the tournament grounds
items.text: MAP OF TOURNAMENT GROUNDS: The Knight's Pavilion (preparation area), The Armory (weapons and armor), The Tournament Lists (jousting field), The Champion's Hall (victory celebration). All knights compete upon the lists for glory and honor.

items.name: champion's hall door
items.description: An ornate door carved with scenes of jousting knights and tournament victories. Three questions are engraved on a golden plaque.

password_questions.question: Who is the tournament champion?
password_questions.hint: Check the herald's scroll, tournament roster, and armorer's journal

password_questions.question: Where does the final joust take place?
password_questions.hint: Multiple documents mention where jousting occurs

password_questions.question: What is your noble rank?
password_questions.hint: The proclamation states who may compete in the tournament

rooms.name: Champion's Hall
rooms.description: You have entered the glorious Champion's Hall! A magnificent chamber with vaulted ceilings and stained glass windows depicting legendary knights. Banners of past champions hang from the walls. In the center, a golden throne awaits the tournament victor. Trumpets sound as you enter, and the assembled nobility rises in applause. You have proven yourself worthy!

items.name: champion's throne
items.description: A magnificent throne of carved oak gilded with gold leaf, reserved for the tournament champion

items.name: laurel crown of victory
items.description: A golden crown of laurel leaves, the symbol of tournament supremacy

items.name: tapestry of champions
items.description: A grand tapestry showing all the great tournament victors throughout history
items.text: The tapestry depicts legendary champions: Sir Roland the Valiant, Sir Percival the Pure, Sir Galahad the Good. Your name shall be added to this honored roll.

items.name: table of trophies
items.description: A table displaying golden cups, jeweled swords, and other prizes of victory

rooms.win_message: Congratulations, noble knight! You have solved the mysteries of the tournament grounds and proven yourself worthy of entering the Champion's Hall. Lord Marshal Sir Edmund places the laurel crown upon your head as the crowd cheers. You are declared the victor of the Grand Tournament! Glory and honor are yours. You win!
